Uses of Class
Card

Uses of Card in <Unnamed>
 

Methods in <Unnamed> that return Card
 Card Deck.deal()
          Removes the "top" card from the deck and returns this Card object.
 Card[] Deck.deal(int n)
          Removes the "top" n cards from the deck and returns an array of these Card objects.
 Card Deck.getCard(int n)
          Returns the specified Card object.
 Card[] Deck.getCards()
          Returns an array of all Card objects remaining in the deck (this does not include those cards that have already been dealt from the deck).
 Card[] Deck.getCards(int first, int last)
          Returns an array of the specified range of Card objects remaining in the deck (this does not include those cards that have already been dealt/removed from the deck).
 Card Deck.pickACardAnyCard()
          Randomly selects and removes a card from the deck and returns this Card object.
 

Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Card
 void Deck.addCard(Card c)
          Adds a card to the "bottom" of the deck.
 void Deck.addCards(Card[] c)
          Adds an array of Card objects to the "bottom" of the deck.
 int Card.compareTo(Card that)
          Compares this card with another card and returns the difference in their values.
 boolean Deck.contains(Card c)
          Reports whether or not the deck contains the specified card.
 void Deck.insertCard(int n, Card c)
          Inserts a card into the deck at the specified index position.
 void Deck.insertCards(int n, Card[] c)
          Inserts an array of Card objects into the deck starting at the specified index position.
 

Constructors in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Card
Deck(Card[] c)
          Creates a custom deck from a specified set of pre-existing playing cards.
